website_summaries.verdict: Great-looking and rugged shoes, these are a good option for CrossFit training, although you may wish to look elsewhere if running is your primary activity.
pros: These sharp-looking shoes offer good support and a comfortable fit, particularly in their roomy toe boxes
They are also very rugged, which comes as no surprise given their “Kevlar-infused” construction
cons: You may wish to consider buying up a half size, as sizing may run small
While praised for use in other elements of CrossFit training, these may not be the best shoes for running

customer_reviews.title: For all gym training & weight lifting, not just Crossfit
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before replacing my old gym shoes and settled on Reebok's Nano 6.0, a Crossfit shoe. While I don't do Crossfit, you gotta admit, if these Kevlar-lined shoes can withstand that stuff, my regular lifting should be easy. I like that Reebok has been perfecting this shoe and their research and market feedback has been included in the product design. They have a flat sole providing maximum, level support from the ground up. They're light weight and breathe. They look decent, too. But, they're holding up well for this 270-pound bodybuilder, and the workouts I subject them to.
customer_reviews.author: Biff Boswell

customer_reviews.title: So far so great.
customer_reviews.text: So apparently Reebok decided to make a 6.0, their goals were: Look Like the Nano 2.0, Fit like the Nano 4.0, Perform like the Nano 5.0. I never owned the 2.0. I loved my 4.0s but they didn't hold up, and my 5.0s held up for over a year before giving up but weren't exactly comfortable from the start. These seem to be the same platform. As the 6.0s but seem so much more flexible and user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob J. Naylor

customer_reviews.title: Good Crossfit/running shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 10, but bought size 10.5 for the extra wiggle room in the front. They felt a bit tight in the width and the right shoe initially hurt squeezed my foot, but felt find after a few uses. I'm currently trying to run about half a mile 2-3 times a week and need the arch support to avoid shin splints that I'm very susceptible to. So far, these shoes have helped me not injure myself again.
customer_reviews.author: SPAM

customer_reviews.title: Had these shoes for several months now and I like them. I wouldn't run more than about 800m ...
customer_reviews.text: Had these shoes for several months now and I like them. I wouldn't run more than about 800m at a time in them as the soles are firm for lifting and jumping. For crossfit workouts they provide a nice wide toe box and good support for lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with these. They fit well and feel good on. They are light but have good support. I use them for running and running HIIT. By coincidence, my son-in-law bought a pair, too, and he's also very happy with his. I read a lot of reviews before trying these and I'm glad I got them.
customer_reviews.author: palisade73

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable High Performande Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I really do like these shoes. I use them for crossfit classes and they perform just like they should. I've been very happy with how they are comfortable as soon as I put them on...no break-in period at all. I ordered my normal size and decided to go 1/2 size larger, It was a close call but I'm happy I did. I like the roomy toe box and the heel that holds my foot securely. I don't see how you could go wrong with these shoes for cross training of any kind.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Crocker

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile shoe
customer_reviews.text: I got this shoe after doing a lot of research. This is my first shoe that I got for lifting in mind. It still works well for treadmill workouts occasionally but I am really enjoying the versatility of the shoe. I'm sure there are better power lifting shoes out there, but I am confident that this shoe beats them in versatility, which is what I like to do at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Durable, light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Although, these are my first pair of training shoes and I have not had a chance to try the Nike Met-cons, I am very satisfied with the durable yet comfortable qualities. Very breathable and plenty of room for my toes yet form fitting around arch, heel and ankle. I've been through a few pairs of cheaper quality shoes but I'm pretty confident these will last a while. Especially after a WOD with rope climb which has torn up other brands. They have what I'm assuming to be Kevlar on the outer inside arch to prevent wear from the rope.
customer_reviews.author: Cedric B.

customer_reviews.title: I always thought Nano 4 was the most comfortable. Do heavy workouts and stayed w/ Nanos
customer_reviews.text: Have had every Nano since Nano 2 including Nano7. I always thought Nano 4 was the most comfortable. Do heavy workouts and stayed w/ Nanos. This is by far the best Nano. Comfortable, sturdy and true to fit. The only problem really hard to find in normal sizes. For me personally far better than the 7 which are really stiff etc but that is another subject. If you can find them buy them!
customer_reviews.author: jrw1779

customer_reviews.title: Great versatility, look great and seem durable
customer_reviews.text: These things are amazing, but I would suggest getting a half size higher as they fit pretty snug. I have wide feet that tend to get swollen when I workout and are hitting the edges of the shoe. Otherwise they feel great when doing deadlifts as well as any cross training. Love that I dont have to feel like im going to topple over when box jumping anymore. These were a great price on Amazon when I got them and they look great on top of it!
customer_reviews.author: Hellhawk

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: So, up until I bought these, I had the Nano 4's. I got these in the same size, figuring that they'd fit the same. The 6's are a bit smaller. At first I thought this would be a problem, but they actually fit better. The fact that they're more snug only helps with stability during lifts and they are still comfortable while running. They are also likely to stretch out a bit, so definitely order your true size. I love these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: AJK

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first "real" shoe I've gotten for Crossfit and I think it's awesome. My foot is a little wider than average and the shoe has enough space to feel 'tight' while allowing wiggle room. They feel great in both lifting & running and they seem to be holding up nicely. Bummed they don't make these anymore, but I'll search for them again when the time comes!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly! It really helps in finishing the WOD, and prevent beginners like me from getting hurt. It's not a good looking shoe, but it functions well. Especially for the workout in bar bell related movements, these shoes is very stable for almost all the situations, especially heels! Perfect protection.
customer_reviews.author: Jia Liang

customer_reviews.title: 0's and they are perfect. I wear a size 11 in womens shoes
customer_reviews.text: I just got mine in, the toe box is a little wider than I normally would wear. But followed Reebok direction and went 1/2 size up from what I wore in my 2.0's and they are perfect. I wear a size 11 in womens shoes, the size 10 in mens were perfect. I have only worn them to one WOD so time will tell on how they wear out. But so far I'm a fan!
customer_reviews.author: Peaches

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. Exactly what I was expecting, the support on the heel is great and the wrap my feet very well. Jumping and moving is very good. Not my first choice to run, but my feet are flat and I over-prone, so that's me (I still have a gen1 Reebok Zigtech and they works great for running and playing basketball. After 2 years I am wearing them out though)
customer_reviews.author: Berzin

customer_reviews.title: Anyone here will tell you that these shoes are great, and they really are
customer_reviews.text: Anyone here will tell you that these shoes are great, and they really are. I wear a size 14 shoe which is almost impossible to find in person, so I always have to order them hoping they'll fit. These fit PERFECTLY. Extraordinarily happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise it's fine and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Toe box is too big. . It also hurts to do leg exercises with these shoes. It could be me I suppose. I'd switch out to a new balance with more cushion for those workouts. Otherwise it's fine and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Wakim

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned the Reebok crossfit lifters and I got the same size in the nanos and they fit really well. I am going on over a year with these shoes and they still look like new (I have only used them indoors). They are holding up well and there really is no "wear and tear" as of yet!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for an all around workout
customer_reviews.text: Great all around shoe for weightlifting and metcons. They don't perform quite as well for heavy lifting compared to a traditional weight lifting shoe, but that was expected. They feel great during the metcons and provide a great feel moving from movements like box jumps to overhead presses.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Hardin

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the Nano 5s!
customer_reviews.text: Tried the Nano 5's and they were horrible. These are comfortable and good for Crossfit. One caveat, these really are NOT for running, the treads do not have great traction in that if you are trying to do sprints, you will slide on the street a little.
customer_reviews.author: V. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great training shoe but be careful with the rope climbs!
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great until the bottom of the shoe ripped on my second time doing rope climbs! Not even 1 month with the shoes and this happened, gonna wear them out a little more (hoping they don't come apart) and then probably switch to Nike. Too bad that the quality of the sole is so lacking, considering everything else feels great.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: This is a great shoe. It has helped my lifts over a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shoe. It has helped my lifts over a standard all purpose sneaker and it has been OK to run in so far. It fits really well,,,,as if it was form fitted to my foot. The toe box is big with lots of room. Some people have complained about this but I like it and it seems to be beneficial during the WOD's..My foot is very stable in the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: durable & comfortable. Not good for long runs (over 1 mile)
customer_reviews.text: Solid choice for typical crossfit workouts. durable & comfortable. Not good for long runs (over 1 mile)
customer_reviews.author: JACOB

customer_reviews.title: The best crossfit shoes to date
customer_reviews.text: The best crossfit shoes to date. beats out the Nike Metcon 2s, of which I have. It's narrower than previous iterations and I should've gotten a half size bigger, but it's still good regardless of that minor fit issue, as my toe is literally hitting the edge of the toe box. It's still lightyears ahead of the nano 5 for comfort and takes all the best things from the 2 and 4 and molds it with the sturdiness of the 5.
customer_reviews.author: Justin G.

customer_reviews.title: All around a good shoe for Crossfit or any mixed modal type of ...
customer_reviews.text: All around a good shoe for Crossfit or any mixed modal type of training. The four star rating is because I don't think like them for really heavy Weight lifting (specifically oly lifting and squatting), but they are good for moderate lifting in workouts. I also do not like them for rope climbs rope climbs. I have used every Nano series and they have always been bad for rope climbing.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H.

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The shoes for the same as my other nano. It is a very comfortable shoe and i haven't had any issues with them during a workout. Overall it is a very comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Spain

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from 4 to 6
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoe! Better support for the foot bed, just enough stiffness to give you added confidence with oly lifts, and the grippy rope climb pad is awesome. I would recommend them! I just upgraded from my nano 4's. These will do great!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse J. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Solid WOD performance. Light weight. I marked no arch support because arch support is some of the cause of foot issues. Let the foot move naturally! Love em'!
customer_reviews.author: A. Petersen

customer_reviews.title: I've had these for a week and I love them. They're perfect for conditioning
customer_reviews.text: These replaced a pair of Nike Metcon 1s, which replaced Reebok Nano 4s. I've had these for a week and I love them. They're perfect for conditioning, circuit training, or CrossFit. They're also great for deadlifts and good for squats, although I prefer my Inov-8 Fastlift for squats. Either way, the Nano 6 is the perfect shoe for working out.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes for cross fit and some weight lifting
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes for cross fit and some weight lifting. Great support, flat feel and fit as expected for my size (8.5).
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Leguizamo

customer_reviews.title: I think these shoes are excellent. As a previous owner of Nano 3s and ...
customer_reviews.text: First, I think these shoes are excellent. As a previous owner of Nano 3s and 4s - these would be my favorite iteration. My only gripe is the toe box is more spacious than I would like for sprints. With that said, these shoes look sharp and feel very well-made. I've had no issues with double unders, cleans, squats, deadlifts, etc.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaving shoes
customer_reviews.text: Recovering from a metartarsal fracture these were the only shoes I could wear for months which didn't cause discomfort to foot and back. Neutral base, minimal arch support (if you need it), grand for grounding type workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: I love this shoe
customer_reviews.text: Just the shoe I have dreamed about and looking for! I love this shoe. Hands down, the best work out shoe I have ever used in my entire life. Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: AirtimeChris

customer_reviews.title: Great crossfit shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use at crossfit classes as my weightlifting shoes were too heavy and hard for WODs. These are great for runs, box jumps, and lifting. I love the way they look as well.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Good for squats and deadlifts
customer_reviews.text: I use these shoes primarily for weight training. Good for squats and deadlifts. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable even with my wider feet
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable even with my wider feet. Good grip for rope climbing. Solid base for lifting. Could perhaps do with a little more arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kiehn

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoe but ran too small and now I cant get in my correct size.
customer_reviews.author: MixedFitnessArtist

customer_reviews.title: Last Of The Best Nanos
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find Nano 6s. Glad they were on here. Price was exceptional. Looks awesome. Best Crossfit shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Tab

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoe! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing shoes. Husband has zero complaints. Recommended this shoe to anyone! Great for lifting, balance during squats, box jumps as well as running. All around awesome shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan R

customer_reviews.title: Great stable shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for some at home functional fitness workouts. I bought a size down from my normal so I can go sock less if I want, and they fit great. Feel much more stable in these than running shoes, and they feel very durable.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. I had the 4.0s and love them. Tried the 5.0s and wasn't a fan of the new design. Reebok got back on track with the 6.0s. great shoe
customer_reviews.author: Broseph

customer_reviews.title: So much better than my last nano's
customer_reviews.text: Fits me better than my nano 3's. My foot is on the narrow side. These feel so much better than my 3's although it's probably f due to the fact that they are 3 years old. Still I never remember my old nano's feeling as good during a run. And in my opinion the look pretty good especially when compared to the 5's
customer_reviews.author: Jav

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for leg day
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for leg day. Originally got size 11.5 but had to return them as they were too big. Got a size 11 instead and they fit me like a glove. My squats feel so much better now.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Not purple but still awesome.
customer_reviews.text: These nano 6s are a dream. My lifting has never been more solid, I dont have to rely on lifters at all and running in them is comfortable. My only complaint is that they arent purple and they definitely look purple in this picture.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not bad for most aspects
customer_reviews.text: Comfy shoes, not bad for most aspects, just make sure you don't assume your size, but true to fit for Reebok sizes.
customer_reviews.author: dawgguy@msstate

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase. Functional and attractive shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Two WOD completed in these so far (walked to the gym for one of them).. Very comfortable and provided good lateral support when changing directions during shuttle runs. Plus they just look sharp!!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: Believe the hype
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know I needed legitimate trainers until I tried these on. I do compound lifts, plyos, sprints and boxing alternately 6x/week and these do the job very well. Get a pair, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: GTX28

customer_reviews.title: Better, But Not as Good as Innov8
customer_reviews.text: Feels lighter than the 5's but still nowhere close to the Innov8 F-Lite 250
customer_reviews.author: Mommy of 4

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for Crossfit.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I like very flat soles but the slight arch support isn't annoying. 10.5 is my size and 10.5 fit snugly, I even loosened the laces somewhat. Foot feels super stable to the floor doing squats, cleans, deadlifts, whatever in Crossfit, which is the goal. Not doofy looking.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: i like them.
customer_reviews.text: light, versatile and snug... i like them... especially for wods where you mix it up.
customer_reviews.author: LOPEZ RUIZ HECTOR

customer_reviews.title: The shoes are lightweight and comfortable. While a bit pricey I am pleased with ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes based on several positive reviews. While some shoes fit narrow there is alot of room in the tow box area of the shoe that makes for a comfy fit for wider feet at the toe. The shoes are lightweight and comfortable. While a bit pricey I am pleased with this purchase and recommend this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: excellent as expected
customer_reviews.text: excellent as expected. Could only be a bit better for running, but I cannot ask more for such an overall shoe.
customer_reviews.author: VINICIUS CAMPOS

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for CrossFit
customer_reviews.text: As usual, Reebok knocks it out of the park with the Nanos. Great shoe for CrossFit, versatile enough for lifting, jumping, rope climbs, etc.
customer_reviews.author: E. Amundson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe for training
customer_reviews.text: feedback from grandson whom I purchased these for. Excellent shoe for training, somewhat short in length. He is pro trainer.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Carter

customer_reviews.title: Sizing!
customer_reviews.text: This is how this shoe fit me compared to other athletic offerings by Nike and New Balance. I primarily use this type of shoe for light lifting and WOD/Metcon use. I've been Crossfitting for about 2-3 years. Sizing: Mens Reebok Nano 6 - 10 Reebok Nano 7 - 10 Nike Metcon 3 - 9.5 Nike Metcon 3 DSX - 9.5 New Balance MX40v1 - 9.5 2E Nike Metcon 2 - 9.5 Nike Romaleos 2 - 9 New Balance Minimus MX20v1 - 9 2E Nike Vomero 6 - 9.5 2E Clarks Desert Boot - 8.5
customer_reviews.author: Ernest

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable ive had these for a few months and they ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable ive had these for a few months and they work well for jogging or just going out. Versatile and aesthetically pleasing.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel

customer_reviews.title: Best nano yet.
customer_reviews.text: It has everything the Nano 5's lacked. Comfortable tongue, tapered sides, and able to breath. As comfortable as the 4's and they feel much more stable when squatting. Easier to run in as well. Reebok is finally fine tuning its game and its paying off.
customer_reviews.author: fzero10

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, improved a ton from lifting in running ...
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe, improved a ton from lifting in running shoes, obviously. Nice and flat feel on the ground. They run a bit small as others suggest, so size up 1/2 size I would say if you are used to a snug fit. For instance, I usually wear as a 9 running shoe that is somewhat snug. I went to a 9.5 in this Nano 6.0, and it is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great feel. Coming from running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great feel. Coming from running shoes, these have a more solid feel underneath the foot, not cushioned like running shoes. This was expected as they are built for CrossFit, and need that supportive base. Very light, but very supportive feel. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Chad Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good for new to Crossfit athletes
customer_reviews.text: Using them for Crossfit and so far have decent cushioning for box jumps and weightlifting. Good for new to Crossfit athletes.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe, smaller than I believe that I ordered. I thought I ordered a 10 1/2 and received a 9 1/2
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty picky when it comes to shoes used for training. These give a solid wide base of support that is excellent for balance. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jack B.

customer_reviews.title: The fit was almost perfect except for the outter toes
customer_reviews.text: The fit was almost perfect except for the outter toes. Its wearable and not too much discomfort, just a little tight. Perhaps my shape of foot wasn't a perfect match,
customer_reviews.author: Louis Cruzado

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are the best! They fit perfect and are very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are the best! They fit perfect and are very comfortable! U can can train or wear them all day!
customer_reviews.author: Juan Jose Cobo Ch

customer_reviews.title: The shoe fits great and works well
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fits great and works well. I wear these at the gym for weightlifting and recently started wearing them at crossfit. I havent ran long distances in them, but they are stable and comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Rali

customer_reviews.title: Great cross training shoe that fits well
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this shoe and use it for mixed workouts, including Plyo, Cardio, and weight/strength training. Fit is great with a wide toe box and good heel support. I wear a men’s size 9 and ordered a size 9. I’ve put it through about 10 workouts and it has performed very well. I have it a 4/5 because I still have not had enough time to evaluate durability.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Trevino

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. Much better than the Nano 5
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Much better than the Nano 5. However the kevlar stitching over the top of your foot is still pretty stiff.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazing. My son wears them to workout everyday day and says he can tell a difference in the fit and the balance of the shoe. They were well worth the money. I am gonna no to get another pair for my other son.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa W.

customer_reviews.title: but these are the best Nanos up to this point
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried the new 7.0, but these are the best Nanos up to this point. Much more stable and more comfortable to run in. Usually, more stability leads to less cushioning but that was not the case with the 6.0
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like the Camo on the sole of the shoe. Fits great and very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for WODs
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for WODs, 200-400m and lighter lifting. Large toe box. All around pleased with them so far after two weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: Gary McKinzie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoe for Crossfit classes - feel fully connected to ground while working out
customer_reviews.author: Tim Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I had tried the shoes and liked them, and can confirm their versatility after a solid week of training!
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: I miss my 2's
customer_reviews.text: Had mine for 6 months and the bottom just started to peel off, had my 2s for three years.
customer_reviews.author: James McMahon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great show comfy toe box much better than nano 5.0 to me
customer_reviews.author: Carlena Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Get your true size
customer_reviews.text: I thought otnwas a good idea buying a size bigger (9m) instead of 8.5m like normal. This shoes for me would have been true size fit if inhad gotten 8.5 size. They looked niced and felt cery comfortable when i used them to squat the one time i wore them.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: I've been missing out
customer_reviews.text: Incredible shoe, great fit and mold. First time I've owned a pair of reeboks and now I feel like I've been missing out. This is perfect for any workout I decide to do from weightlifting to sprinting, it is crazy comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Received them last night and did a 100 burbees and mountain climbers. 👍🇺🇸
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for working out , they conform to your foot like no shoe I have never worn before.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Perez

customer_reviews.title: Great Crossfit show
customer_reviews.text: Best Nano version I have bought so far. Very confortable for WODs (including running)!
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: one of the best nano's ever made
customer_reviews.text: they are ok.. one of the best nano's ever made.. they are very confortable tho
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Censi

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these instead of the nano 7.0. I am glad I did as I saved over $60.
customer_reviews.author: customer4572941

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Second pair - love these! Very comfortable and size is right on.
customer_reviews.author: wenjem

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoe, but the "white" colorway doesn't contain much ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe, but the "white" colorway doesn't contain much white, looking at it from any distance it looks like a dirty white.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kuffel

customer_reviews.title: Hubby bday gift a hit
customer_reviews.text: Got them as a birthday present for my husband. He loves them. He varies between a 10.5 and 11 show size. Bought him size 11 he refers to as perfect. Comfortable fit throughout entire daily CrossFit training routine. Going to buy him a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Tygerlyly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. They helped me a lot in my lifts. Reebok nailed it with these.
customer_reviews.author: JuanMa Heredia

customer_reviews.title: and these are great. Plenty wide
customer_reviews.text: My feet are rectangular, and I have trouble finding shoes off the shelf that fit well, and these are great. Plenty wide, and quite comfortable, I'm a big fan!
customer_reviews.author: jkten

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pieces of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Pieces of equipment, I can't recommend them enough. Deadlift and squats felt solid and then I went for a run afterwards. I have nothing bad to say about these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable! I just got them and haven't worked out ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable! I just got them and haven't worked out in them yet, but as far as fit and comfort, they are totally a good fit!
customer_reviews.author: RobSquare

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes for Crossfit!
customer_reviews.text: I have been doing Crossfit for two years now and buying these shoes made a HUGE difference in my workout and my feet feel much better after the workouts. I think people will have the same positive experience with these shoes that I did. I read a review that these shoes run a bit larger than normal so I bought the shoes slightly bigger than what I normally buy for myself. That was excellent advice. I suggest you follow that advice as well.
customer_reviews.author: J.A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Had the immediate comfort of the nano 2s combined with the excellent stability of the nano 5s. Not a great shoe for running, but excellent for power lifting, Olympic lifting, and calisthenics.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Montanio

customer_reviews.title: Nice comfortable snug fit and a level feel when doing ...
customer_reviews.text: I go to the gym regularly and these shoes have performed well. Nice comfortable snug fit and a level feel when doing squats and deadlifts. Too soon to tell if durable but seems to be put together well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve N.

customer_reviews.title: ... these a short time but they are the most comfortable shoes I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have only had these a short time but they are the most comfortable shoes I have ever owned. I bought them because I plan on doing crossfit and now I wear them anytime I do any workout.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Wide in the toe area. Which is good for me! I know some people don't like them becuase of that but this is one of the main reasons I chose these shoes. The area amazing. Highly reccomended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great show if you liked 5.0 you'll love 6
customer_reviews.author: David erwin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Comfortable and form fitting. They are also holding up extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for keeping Crossfit workouts; particularly helps me with squats.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda J. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: The best Nano yet!
customer_reviews.text: I have Nano 5s, Nano Pumps, METCON 1 and 2s....none of them are as good at the 6.0. They are light, comfortable, durable, and fit a little tighter than the 5s or Metcon 1s. The toe box is still plenty roomy though smaller than the Nano 5s, and they just plain feel better than any shoe before them. If you're looking for an all around CrossFit shoe, look no further than the Nano 6.0. If you want a good shoe JUST for lifting, go with the Metcon 2.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kraklau

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes got them for weight training and cardio probably ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes got them for weight training and cardio probably not a good running shoe. Great price and delivered faster than promised
customer_reviews.author: mulletman

customer_reviews.title: favorite next to the nano 2
customer_reviews.text: apart from the nano 2.0s, these are my favorite crossfit shoe to date. good fit and quick to break in (but not break down).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Reebok Men's CROSSFIT Nano 6.0 Cross Trainer
product_meta.description:
Add innovation to the much-loved list in this reebok cross fit nano 6.0. This update's re-engineered anatomical design makes for a more locked-in stability that functions flawlessly through woods. Plus, the precision details like the textured rope pro+ shank let you tackle cross fit-specific activities with confidence. A kevlar®-infused upper ratchets up the durability for one unforgettable shoe.

Reebok was founded for one of the best reasons possible: athletes wanted to run faster. So in the 1890s, Joseph William Foster made some of the first known running shoes with spikes in them. By 1895, he was in business making shoes by hand for top runners; and before long his fledgling company, J.W. Foster and Sons, developed an international clientele of distinguished athletes.
